intro: Phaulopsis falcisepala, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phaulopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
